heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: Today ranked 2nd for the heaviest rainfall ever in our records, with a peak intensity of 16.6mm per hour sustained for 3.2 hours, resulting in a total accumulation of 5.69mm.  The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: We are in the midst of one of the longest rainy periods recorded.  This rainy period is ranked 4th since records began in August 2024.  The current stretch started on 26 August 2025 and has lasted 10 days.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: There is no heatwave at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwaves, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (197°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.9°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 10%) and rainfall (down 1.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in rainfall (up 1.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 1.9°C), inside temperature (up 1.7°C), and cloud levels (up 692 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 809.2m higher than yesterday, 364.5m higher than the past week, 692.2m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 565m to 1838m and averaged 1919.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; the temperature will feel pleasantly warm. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. Moderate rainfall, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and strong and powerful sunlight. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
